A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I didn't so much mind the long run time\, but I did notice it. It was interesting\, with action scenes that had plenty of dramatic impact. There were a few rather gaping plot holes that I thought about only after it was over. People are bashing this film because it didn't cater to their fan theories\, or a purple haired woman was in charge of the Rebellion. Frankly those complaints are childish and miss the point. This is unlike any other Star Wars movie\, but it is definitely a Star Wars movie. \n\nIt's not without its flaws. There's an entire gambit that our heroes go on that results in absolutely nothing lost or gained. There's a sense that there are no stakes\, since every character that dies is inconsequential. There's also a sense of breaking with tradition in the Jedi order itself\, that many fans probably didn't like. I get where this complaint is coming from\, but I kind of want to see where they go from here. Enjoyable\, but definitely with flaws.
